001package tictactoe;
002
003/**
004 * Represents an immutable coordinate in a two dimensional system.
005 * 
006 * @author Tapio Malmberg
007 */
008public class Coordinate {
009    /**
010     * The X value.
011     */
012    public final int x;
013    
014    /**
015     * The Y value.
016     */
017    public final int y;
018
019    /**
020     * Creates a new Coordinate at ({@code x}, {@code y}).
021     * @param x the x value of the coordinate
022     * @param y the y value of the coordinate
023     */
024    public Coordinate(int x, int y) {
025        this.x = x;
026        this.y = y;
027    }
028
029    /**
030     * Returns true if the coordinates have the same x and y values.
031     * @param other the coordinate to compare to
032     * @return true if the coordinates are the same
033     */
034    public boolean equals(Coordinate other) {
035        if (other == null)
036            return false;
037        else
038            return this.x == other.x && this.y == other.y;
039    }
040
041    /**
042     * Moves a coordinate into the given direction by one x and/or y value.
043     * @param dir the direction to move to
044     * @return the coordinate of the new position
045     */
046    public Coordinate move(Direction dir) {
047        return new Coordinate(x + dir.xVec, y + dir.yVec);
048    }
049
050    /**
051     * Moves a coordinate into the given direction {@code times} times.
052     * @param dir the direction to move to
053     * @param times how many steps the coordinate is moved
054     * @return the coordinate of the new position
055     */
056    public Coordinate move(Direction dir, int times) {
057        return new Coordinate(x + dir.xVec * times, y + dir.yVec * times);
058    }
059}
